Nana's Retreat was great except for the pool that was advertised and pictured as clean and clear water was anything but. The inside of the home was very clean and well maintained. Check in instructions were very clear and everything was easy to locate. I loved the thought to have extra towels and linens ready for guests. Other than missing out on enjoying some pool time in this hot Georgia weather, everything was hospitable about Nana's Retreat. Hayley was very easy to contact and she did inform me of the pool having issues the day before check in. I was under the impression it was still swimmable, but unfortunately due to recent heavy rains, it absolutely wasn't.
If you're looking for a clean place to lay your head for a night or two with a friendly host, then this is the place.

review_text: This cabin was fully loaded and stocked with all the necessities and more. It has a nice cozy atmosphere. The inside was well stocked with towels, extra bedding, all kitchen necessities, and even a few toys for the kids. They do have quite a few antiques throughout the cabin, which was really cool. It was nice and spacious. The outside was on a beautiful piece of land with a nicely stocked lake and a row boat. My whole family came out and we had the best reunion. We were able to grill out on the back porch and make smores in a separate area on the side of the cabin in a fire pit. Mary Pat was an outstanding host and was just a phone call away if we needed her. However, we didn't need anything that wasn't already provided. We had the best time and would definitely like to rent again in the near future. If you're considering renting an airbnb in the Thomaston area, I highly recommend this cabin. There is also another cabin located on this property that is available to rent as well.

We went tubing down the river, cooked out on the grill, and hung out at the park all day. Highly recommend it !
The cabin is so cozy and cute. We made sâ€™mores by the fireplace, hopped in the row boat out back, and even got to see the goats and horse in the morning behind the cabin.
The town is about 15 min away and thereâ€™s a restaurant we loved (fish peddler).
Mary Pat was very responsive and I appreciate it (I know we messaged her quite a few times)
The WiFi wasnâ€™t the best. We only needed it to watch a pay-per-view that we ordered one night... but luckily thereâ€™s a TON of dvds in the laundry shed that we chose from. Overall, had such a great time.

review_text: We had the most relaxing stay at Donna's. We felt like we were at home. The place was so clean. We didn't have to cook, but we did find the necessary things we needed for drinks and light snacks. We had a large family wedding on the 24th at The Rock. Donna's place was perfect for us not to have to travel very far. There was an emergency with a niece's son. He had been at basketball camp for 3 days and the timing was off for picking him up, getting him home and cleaned up in time to get to the wedding. Donna allowed my niece & husband to stop at her place to get him cleaned up. This was so kind of her and it worked out perfectly! We loved being in the country. A perfect place for myself, husband, brother & sister-in-luv to have. We appreciated all the communication with Donna! What a gem!! We were blessed and would definitely stay again!! A++++++++++

review_text:
Donnaâ€™s place was perfect for my friend and I! We booked it to do an online seminar where we knew we would be super loud, dancing, and yelling super late every night. It being detached and away from their house made it perfect (we did still let them know what we were doing and check that it would be okay before we booked though).
We felt completely safe and comfortable. It was bigger than we thought it would be from the pictures. It had a fully stocked kitchen with everything we needed to cook including salt, pepper, and some spices. There were also plenty of snacks we were told we could help ourselves to. It had two nice big TVs and was decorated cute for the season. Donna gifted us some of her friendâ€™s homemade soap that was so sweet and let us check out super late since she didnâ€™t have anyone checking in the next day, which allowed us to get extra sleep that we were really grateful for.
The beds were really comfortable as well! We did not get a chance to use the pool because of weather and being busy with our seminar.
Would highly recommend, including to just have a nice little getaway from Atlanta and hang out for a day or two.

Peggy was a wonderful host and her home is beautiful, peaceful and full of her very special touches. She is extremely accommodating and very responsive. The space is large and comfortable with outside areas to lounge or roam and indoor sitting rooms, two bedrooms, if needed, and a private bath. The home is older, so it has all the lovely architectural and period details. There is a coffee/tea nook with a small fridge and treats she encourages you to take. Overall, it was a lovely time and I will return when I am in the area again, if she will have me.
Thanks, Miss Peggy

review_text:
We recently stayed at Peggy's Picturesque B&B for a weekend wedding, and it was absolutely wonderful! Peggy proved to be incredibly accommodating; she allowed us to ship our wedding gift in advance, saving us from traveling with a bulky package. Additionally, her flexibility with our check-in time due to shifting pre-wedding plans was a godsend.
The home itself is both adorable & comfortable, filled with thoughtful touches like extra toiletries and snacks for late-night cravings. It truly felt like a home away from home. We also enjoyed the beautiful scenery that added a perfect backdrop to our stay & morning coffee on the porch.
Peggy's hospitality didn't stop at just amenities; her warm conversations & the stories about her house restoration further enriched our experience. If you're looking for a cozy and inviting place to stay, Peggyâ€™s Bed and Breakfast is the ideal choice. Thank you, Peggy, for a fantastic weekend!

Peggyâ€™s place, Wisteria Way, was way above our expectations! Her home is clean, lovely, welcoming and setting very peaceful and really a wonderful respite in a quiet neighborhood.
The bed super comfortable giving us a good nightâ€™s sleep!
We appreciated Peggyâ€™s prompt communication, willingness to accept our late arrival and greeting us.
We had private bath (hot water and excellent pressure in shower) and set off private area with microwave and refrigerator and bottled spring water where she has all sorts of offerings for breakfast: coffee, teas, delicious home made muffins, fresh fruit, refrigerator stocked with yogurt, Sprite, OJ; small crockpot, toaster, all sorts of cooking utensils.
She has even stocked the bath with lotions, bath items, and anything a traveler may have forgotten.
We have stayed at many Airbnbâ€™s throughout US and have to say Peggyâ€™s is tops! We wish we could have stayed for more than one night just to soak in the beauty of her grounds so encourage you to book!!

I booked the Protea room last minute, explaining my plans to go somewhere else had fallen through. Ms. Peggy was prompt in communication, kind and understanding. Upon learning that I was there to be alone for my wedding anniversary after losing my husband, she gave me flowers and a gift card. As a widow, it made my heart feel more at ease. Most people wouldn't think to be so kind. The little coffee/tea nook was adorable, stocked with anything you would need for a continental breakfast. The bathroom was also stocked if you forgot anything.
The bed was divine and comfortable. The TV and interner worked great as well.
This is a great place to stay if you are looking for a quiet and unique place.

My overall feeling was that I visited a distant relative who forgot that I was coming and did their best to get ready.
Pros: The beds were very comfortable and even my dad slept well.
Cons: The first two are the most important because they negate the ADA compliance and pose a health concern.
1. The ramps to the unit were covered in leaves, sticks and other debris. This was a trip and slip hazard for my 78 year old dad and those that rely on ADA compliant ramps. When I messaged the host she replied â€œ We blow the ramps off often but there are so many leaves that itâ€™s impossible to keep up.â€.
2. There were mouse droppings under the sink
3. The right half of the couch does not recline (as experienced when sitting on the couch)
4. There were several inches of ash from previous guests left in the fireplace
5. There were crumbs or dirt on the couch cushions. It looked like the living room was not cleaned after the previous guest

Start off by saying, WOW, what an experience! Would we go back or recommend this place to anyone? Definitely!
The reason we were going to be in the area was to attend our grandsonâ€™s wedding at a venue about 2-miles away. There were eight of us: all adults. All of us were coming from out of state.
Last fall we were visiting family in McDonough, so we took the opportunity to start looking around. We looked at hotels in Thomaston and other towns nearby. It was obvious that we didnâ€™t want to drive through the countryside at night. So, I went online and looked for an Airbnb. This Airbnb got my attention due to its location and how interesting it looks on the website. We drove out to see it and once we did that, we booked both cabins.
We found the cabins very clean with all the amenities of home: nice beds, a well-stocked kitchen with all the appliances, toiletry items and even coffee. We found sitting outside on the front porch in the morning a treat: quiet except for the rooster crowing.

review_text:
This was a wonderful place for a retreat!! I stayed for three weeks â€” it was very peaceful. I appreciated that I could bring my dog as it was much cheaper than boarding her.
The kitchen is well-stocked with plenty of pots and pans and utensils, there is a fridge/freezer and stove/oven. and there is a grill right outside the back door on the patio. The bathroom has a walk-in shower as well as a claw foot bathtub. There are also laundry facilities in a separate building very close by.
The pond is a short walk away, and there are donkeys and cows to visit as well. There is plenty of land to take a nice long walk without going on the road.
There is a Dollar General about 5 mins away, and grocery stores about 15 mins away in Thomaston.
Nicole was very responsive to emails and even emailed to check in with me to make sure I had everything I needed.
All in all, this was an awesome place to stay. I would definitely return.

name: Raymond

Rating, 4 stars

Stayed with kids
review_text:
This is a wonderful place full of charm, but may not be for all-comersâ€¦ at least for now. We encountered a bit of disrepair in the form of wood rot on decking that gave-way underfoot. This was quickly repaired, but could be a real problem for a disabled person.
TV options are limited to DVDs, and though WiFi is available, you wonâ€™t be streaming above SD at the speeds offered. Youâ€™ll need to remember to bring your streaming box from home to make that work.
Still, you donâ€™t come to a place like this to sit on the couch. Outside the pond awaits with fishing from the pier or paddle boat. There are lots of trails to locations around the property with animals etc. There are numerous destinations nearby with plenty of local flavor.
The amenities are bespoke and vary from subpar to excellent, so YMMV in terms of experience. The electric stove eyes were uneven and hard to work with effectively, but the shower was wide comfortable and very relaxing. The master bed has a great mattress and sleeps well, but the chairs are all hard wood and uncushioned except for one love-seat in the living room. The dock and pound are a great place to spend the day fishing or just relaxing, but slippery planks and wood rot may make the walk too it feel less than safe.
I can recommend for people who know what they are getting into and are willing to go the rough edges to enjoy a real rustic experience. The price is very affordable for what you get and being â€˜pet friendlyâ€™ is an awesome added bonus. For the elderly, the disabled, or the very young; despite its appeal, this property is in need of investment to be comfortable for all guests.

Mary Pat and her Husband Rick have created a very special place here inside and out. Although we only stayed overnight, a family could easily enjoy a few days of old timeyness and enjoy the outdoorsas well. It's definitely not your typical experience, but that's what this location is all about. One thing to take note of, there is a fairly strong musty smell that would likely bother anyone sensitive to that sort of thing. I have respiratory issues, and one night is all I could handle. That being said, I'm glad we stoppedand experienced what they had to offer. Mary Pat and Rick were great hosts, very attentive and quick to respond.

review_text: We loved staying at Mary Pat's and Rick's cabin! We loved having the lake there for my 10 yr old daughter to learn how to fish. Every morning when she woke up, she would change and head over to the lake to practice. We also loved the ramp from Cabin 2 leading all the way to the lake. We enjoyed having their Great Pyrenees dogs visit us everyday and sometimes staying overnight at the door. Our 2 little pups had a blast there as well sniffing the grounds and just being outside. It was such a treat staying at this 1800 cabin. It's also just a few min away from Sprewell Bluff which is such a nice park close to the Flint River. We will definitely stay here again the next time we drive to TN from FL.

The cabin was perfect. We had a need to evacuate with three large dogs and didnâ€™t want to be crammed in a hotel room. Instead we found this cabin and we had a wonderful hurrication.
We stayed for 8 days. Our son fished and hiked, we ran, played with the goats and were able to work. The WiFi connection was good.
It was great to be able to do laundry too. Mary Pat and Rick are wonderful hosts.
The cabin was perfect for our family of four. The bedrooms are large and we even brought our dogsâ€™ crates and they fit. Our son loved the loft! The cabin is rustic but it has WiFi and airco!
The kitchen was equipped with everything we needed. We even got a few fresh eggs from Mary Lats chickens.
Overall it was a perfect place to spend time away from home.

name: Marvin
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2018
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Mary Pat and her husband are two wonderful people and their spirit is reflected throughout the cabins and the property. I have always loved log cabins especially really old genuine ones and staying there was a dream come true. Although it might have been a little rougher without the plumbing and electricity way back when... I kept finding details that I had not seen at first glance and it made me smile every time as I recognized the same sweet touch. The bathroom had everything we needed and quaint touches all over it too. I am a gardener and my heart was glad to see each blossom reflect the owner's love and care. Although Mary Pat and her husband were not on the property during our stay (someone else was keeping the grounds), we were warmly greeted by their furry friends who were a nice presence for our son. I must say I enjoyed them too!
He very much enjoyed fishing at the pond even though this time he had the right equipment but did not get a catfish (last time the catfish broke his line)...However, he hardly had time to put his bait in the water before he would get something on the line! I had never seen so much fish! The fishing deck is so well thought of with its shady cover and outdoor furniture. I love hearing the natural spring sound in the background. A previous time we had used the boat on the pond and it made for a special intimate conversation and togetherness. Also loved the little porch area with the grill just outside the kitchen. Made for nice steaks.
The cabin was very comfortable and we slept so well we got up almost late.
Wanting to stay away from the city I cooked a lot and found a kitchen well stocked with pots, pans and utensils. The upstairs room is adorable under the gable. I could not resist sitting on the genuine era rope bed...and would have loved to sleep on it!
We were very thankful for Mary Pat's kindness to allow us to make use of a little more time as no guest were arriving that same day. She was excellent with communication by the way!
I hope I get to come back during the winter to stay put the whole time with chestnuts roasting in the fire...

This was a nice private place on a creek that finally flowed after the hurricane came through, although that was not the reason I stayed there. That was almost completely taken up by my cosmetics/ hygiene products as there is no room in the bathroom to put anything. I know that there was nothing in the kitchen that I was not aware of as I was not cooking there anyway, but there was only 1 can light in the kitchen, no under cabinet or over the sink lighting. When the sun was up in the morning, the light was ok but we had some cloudy days and it was very difficult to read anything. The bed was super comfortable but I guess I did not pay attention when I booked it as there was only 1 bathroom and had to negotiate some steep steps

Had a great time. The hosts were very helpful and accommodating. The place is very cute, and the setting is amazing. Everything you need to cook is available, the bed is very comfortable. The place is well priced.
Two things to be aware of, these are not at all complaints just two things I thought would be useful to know, they did not inhibit my stay at all.
The main house shares a driveway with the rental home so they are closer than I expected. The rental faces the river and the view is amazing, you will not see the main house when you are looking towards the river but it is nearby.
There are other dogs on the property that walk around unleashed, they are very sweet! I brought my German Shepherd who is a little wary of other dogs so that was an adjustment for him but the other dogs were great. Just a heads up for any other dog owners with anxious puppies. Other than that my dog had a blast climbing around the river and sniffing in the woods. I would stay again anytime.

I was taking this spring break week as a much needed get away, bonus it was also my birthday week. The reviews & the view of the creek flowing, sold me on my decision. Kayla & Joel are amazing, extremely friendly hosts, plus the doggies! Their hospitality was impressive & definitely appreciated! The cabin is super cute, the location is close to many things I had planned to do. Sitting out on the patio, listening to the creek, sipping coffee in the morning & reading a book was the most peaceful, beautiful, relaxing atmosphere & just what my soul needed, or wine in the evening. Joel even took time out of his schedule to make sure my 15 year old son was able to catch some fish, beings as that was his goal on the trip. We had an fantastic time & Iâ€™d highly recommend for a small family or a couples retreat! Will be back!

name: Bonnie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We stayed at the cozy cabin for almost a week in October 2021.
We throroughly enjoyed our stay. We relaxed each evening on the Patio watching and listening to the creek.
We also spent a few evenings by the firepit. Very relaxing!
The creek was pretty high at the time and quite loud! It calmed down after a few days.
We hiked several places in the area: Sprewell Bluff, Pine Mountain and High Falls.
The weather was perfect for hiking in shorts!
The cabin is pet friendly and the owners have a couple of adorable Doodles who visited us often. They were quite friendly.
We looked forward to being 'Doodled' in the morning and evening.
We brought our little 15lb Rat Terrier Buddy and he enjoyed the property and loved the hiking too!
The cabin was very clean and just as pictured! The kitchen is well stocked. Do not be afraid of the 'hot plate' -
it is actually a nice two burner cook top!
While there is no free standing range/oven, there is a nice toaster oven/air fryer and a large microwave.
We didn't have any trouble cooking any meals!
The cabin was quite well stocked too. I usually will bring extra paper towels/toilet paper/trash bags - but all were present and plentiful.
I read a review that someone said that the water smelled funny - I would agree - but it reminded me of the sulfur smell that is common from a well.
I didn't ask if the cabin had city water/sewer like I do in town - I just assumed it had well/septic.
I did brush my teeth and showered from the tap water, and I'm alive and well! LOL!
We did opt to get some bottled water in town for coffee/tea/drinking.
The owners were lovely to work with and we had no issues with anything at all.
We totally enjoyed the stay and hope to return next year for more hiking.

We would absolutely stay here again!

review_text: Had a little trouble finding it due to the way the neighborhood is set up. The house is down a long driveway and sits behind the house facing the road. Had someone come unlock and get is inside within reasonable time. We had an issue with yellow jackets being in the house each night. Most were dying as they entered but obviously there is an infestation somewhere. The host did ask me if we noticed any but only after our stay and after I stepped on a live one and got stung. Hopefully this will be corrected. Otherwise our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. There were plenty of towels, linens and toiletries. Only thing I would suggest is a bigger trash can for the kitchen. The one there was the size for a bathroom. We were there on business so there wasnâ€™t a lot of leisure time spent at the house, but it would be nice if youâ€™re looking for a quiet stay.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My husband and I are SO thankful we found Ms. Annie's Guest House, because we did NOT want to stay in the hotels in Thomaston.
The house is so, so gorgeous and charming. Upon our arrival, Roger came out to our car and greeted us, and helped us with our bags! He explained everything to know about our room and the lounge and our stay overall, and our conversations with him were always so sweet and enjoyable! We told him one of my friends just had a baby with a couple complications, and he asked how the baby and the mama were doing, which was so considerate and very appreciated by us. He also asked us what our favorite yogurt is, and he was sure to stock it in the mini-fridge for us, which was so special, and such a kind gesture. He gave us a sweet card and a gift on the last night of our stay, and it made my heart melt! There were so many thoughtful touches, and we were so thankful that Roger cared so much about making us feel right at home!!
We stayed in the Garden Room, which was so cozy and beautiful. The pillows, sheets, mattress, and bath towels were all so soft and plush!! The bath towels were 100% Egyptian cotton, so we knew Roger desires the best for his customers!!
We were always so excited to come back to the house, because we knew we had a warm, cozy bed to sleep in, and it felt just like we were in our home away from home.
Roger, we can't thank you enough for all you did to make our stay the best stay possible!! Ms. Annie's is a gem in Thomaston, and if you're not staying here, you're missing out BIG TIME.

Roger is definitely a southern gentleman through and through!
The bed was so comfy and the house is nice and quiet, so I slept like a log my whole stay. I loved the upstairs parlor as a nice little common area to escape my room while there. The location is perfect and I urge everyone to take advantage of his suggestions for experiencing local Thomaston. Make sure you get to meet his two rescue dogs as well!

Jaredâ€™s location was EXACTLY what my family was looking for! It is a great spot on the Flint River and has its own little private island that we could fish and kayak off of. We loved drinking our coffee on the front porch looking out at the River. The house is very open with a large kitchen and living area, the bedrooms were clean and comfortable and the AC worked great! We loved it so much that we are planning to come back next year!!
I grew up in a rural area, so Iâ€™m used to bugs, snakes, GA red clay and absolutely NO cell service! So if you are city folk and expect something pristine with high speed internet, this may not be the place for you.
I almost donâ€™t want to give such a good review because when I come back, it may be fully booked! But if youâ€™re looking for somewhere to get off the grid and enjoy the River, this is a great place to stay.

The renovations and upgrades were top notch. The little â€œislandâ€ and walking area were nice.
Unfortunately, it was not clean as you would expect when arriving for a night. Cleanliness is a big factor for us, and even my kids noticed and were hesitant to get into the beds.
What made matters worse on this particular night was that there was no wifi. In the middle of nowhere with no service, we couldnâ€™t even communicate with the owners our issues.
Place has potential, but wasnâ€™t ready for us.

name: Steven
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
July 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: We travel alot, sometimes twice a month. So we're getting accustomed to Airbnb stays. The day of our stay i found it odd we didn't get a email from the host with check in information. Good thing Airbnb message had the address after receiving payment in full. We arrived at the home and checked email, but still no email from the host. I tried to email to get lockbox info but there was no cellphone service reception in this area. I tried to get a signal but nothing. My wife couldn't get a signal either. So we drove 2 miles away to get a signal. Once we got the signal we emailed for the lockbox info. Once we get that, we drove back to the house, get inside and then there's no power. We drove back 2miles down the road to email. She said it was storms that knocked out power and someone was coming to fix it. Understandable because it was heavy storms that week. I told her i can't message her with no service but she said when power come on wifi should work. We went back to the house and sat outside waiting for restoration of power. We ate on front porch. When it got darker we went inside and waited. Power came up around 8pm that night but wifi never came up so I couldn't reach out to host. What was very uncomfortable is all the large front windows and glass door. No coverage for windows so people could look into the dark nights there. My wife didn't want to go out to kitchen at night because how exposed it was. Bedrooms have blinds but not livingroom. The next morning still no wifi. Satellite TV finally came up but by then we had enough. We cleaned up and left around 8am. We drove to town and messaged that we left and was heading home. The only response seemed more like they weren't being empathetic about our situation and responding about showing up at their pizzeria they owned in town and getting a appetizer. I was disappointed because despite the circumstances I didn't blame them but empathetic at the moment wouldn't went a long way. I didn't want to write a review but I decided to after all and hope moving forward communication emails and feedback would be better. As a final note, it's a nice place with a nice view. You may have cellphone service issues but that shouldn't prevent you from enjoying peace.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Paulette's cabin was a dream. We were just passing through and stayed just a night, but is was such a fun experience. My little boys loved running around the farm when we arrived, and I so enjoyed watching the animals and the sun set before we turned in to our cozy stay in the primitive cabin. We have been reading through Little House on the Prairie series, and it felt like the perfect place to stay for my boys to experience a little bit what it may have been like for Laura (but with ac, electricity and running water lol). Both Forsyth and Barnsville were charming little towns that had several options to eat and walk around. And Paulette was such a gracious host. She obviously has put in years and all of her heart to cultivating her beautiful farm.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Paulette's Place is an oasis of tranquility.
The cabin sits on a beautiful ranch, where you can enjoy watching a diverse range of farm animals, including goats, cows, turkeys, and horses.
The cabin itself is clean, functional, and decorated with local antiques. It is rustic yet cozy, and conveys a sense of what life was like "way back then."
The surrounding areas are hilly, with dense forests and small, welcoming towns interspersed throughout.
I highly recommend Paulette's Place to anyone looking to connect with nature and discover the daily rhythms of life on a Georgia ranch.

review_text: This home met our needs very well for the short time we needed to be there. The play area was perfect for our children. We felt they were safe in the yard on the playground and felt very comfortable with them around the animals. We enjoyed the private, peaceful surroundings away from other people. The house is decorated very interesting, very similar to my parents' house, so it was familiar to my children. Lighting in the bathroom was a little dim for getting ready to attend a wedding. The kitchen was a little crowded for when cooking as there is no counter. It would be helpful to have some space to sit other personal belongings or shelves or hooks to hang them on. We did make use of the cook top, toaster oven, and high chair. Hostess was very friendly and helpful with anything we needed. Overall, we enjoyed our visit, definitely would recommend over a hotel and would book again when passing through the area.

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This place is absolutely adorable, and Ms. Paulette's hospitality is second to none! Nestled in a working multi-species farm, there are tons of things to do and see without even having to leave the yard. The dog is the sweetest thingever and we were greeted by her upon arrival. Lambs played in the backyard as the turkeys wandered in the front. The sunrise is true beauty at its finest and Ms. Paulette's granddaughters are an absolute delight! Close to a lot of smaller historic cities and surrounded by adventure, this is the type of stay you need to add to your bucket list.

The ranch is huge and full of animals to delight the kids who had free range everywhere. My granddaughters loved the freedom to roam, which they did from morning to night. These city gals acted like regular farm kids...which was a joy to see.
There is only a very small microwave, and two portable electric burners, and only one frying pan and a small refrigerator. No freezer.
If you plan to cook, bring your own cooking pot, but I am sure Paulette would have provided one had I asked.
She is delightful.

review_text: If you love farms and antiques, you'll love this place! This was the most convenient place for us to stop on our trip overnight, but I didn't get to feel all the charm until the next morning. We didn't get in till after dark, and that made it a little more difficult to find, but it was very comfortable and very quiet. We weren't there long enough to eat or use anything other than the restroom, so I can't comment on any of that. Seeing all the animals the next morning on the working farm reminded me of my childhood. Paulette was so sweet and I loved chatting with her that morning. If I had the chance to do this alone without my two teenagers, it would have been amazing. Thank you Paulette!

With some places it is very clear the instant that you walk in that the host spent a lot of time thinking about setting up the space to make the guests comfortable. This was one of them. There were so many little touches in every room that it was obvious that she wanted to provide a top notch experience for the guests.
One such touch was the bath robes that were very nice to have when you got out of the shower since it was cold outside. But that was just one of many.
The place was spotless and very comfortable with every amenity a traveler would need. I honestly can't say enough nice things about it. There were some excellent food choices less than 10 minutes away in Zebulon.
If/when I come back to the area - I will definitely stay here again without considering anywhere else. Stay here - you will be happy you did.

The only drawback, no eating place close that we found, it is several miles to a restaurant, so take snacks to get you by or stop at the Dollar General Store on the way in. EXCELLENT!

review_text:
We really loved this place! The photos were very accurate, it was super clean, tastefully decorated, had very comfortable bed & furniture. Good parking. Here are some small things that I really liked: Quiet spa music played while sitting on porch area. Lots of towels & toiletries available. Comfy robes provided. Snacks, drinks & coffee with cream & sugar provided. Plenty of mirrors so 2 people could shave, put on makeup, get dressed, etc., at the same time. 2 luggage holders. Subdued lighting in bedroom (I hate LED bulbs in nightstand lamps!), plus a reading light attached to each side of bed headboard so one person could read while the other slept. Plenty of power strips.
The hosts have REALLY done a great job & we would DEFINITELY stay here again!

review_text: We wanted a quiet secluded getaway for our anniversary that was close enough to Atlanta to leave our teenagers home alone, so we could get back in a couple of hours in an emergency. And this is exactly what we found at the carriage house! It was a wonderful week. Decor was cute. Bed was super comfortable. No carpet, no smoking, and no pets made it feel and smell really clean. We cooked our own breakfast at the house. My wife had just got her motorcycle and we wanted to ride at slow speeds with straight roads, we would ride out for lunch at local restaurants in several neighboring towns and then come back for a nap. The shower was perfect for relaxing after our rides. Warmer weather than the mountains and no crowds like the beach during spring break. After supper we would lay in bed and watch TV.

name: Alexandria
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: I really can't say enough about this stay. It is exactly as it looks in the pictures, and the description is accurate. The whole cottage is very well appointed. Everything we could have needed was in the kitchen, including some nice extras like ziplock bags that we needed in a pinch. She provided all necessary toiletries, and again extras like q-tips, makeup wipes, and bathrobes. There is a VERY large closet type area at the back entrance where we had all the room we needed to put luggage and hanging clothes. There was a really thoughtful basket of snacks that we were very excited about. She provided hot chocolate, a TON of teas to choose from, and very nice coffee options if you are a coffee person. The king bed was so, so comfortable and the sheets are soft and smooth! There was plenty of space in the bedroom for my son's pack and play. Access to the bathroom is NOT through the bedroom, so you won't disturb anyone who wants to go to bed early! All of the doors are sliding barn doors, so they do not seal or lock. Just something to keep in mind in case that's important to you. It is a little bit of a drive to get to the surrounding attractions, so make sure you know how far you will be driving. I personally prefer a bit of a drive and a very nice place to stay over a convenient distance and substandard accomodations.The only other thing I want to note is that if there is a truck parked in the driveway in front of the camper, then there isn't a very wide clearance for luggage. Just make sure not to hit the truck! I am already trying to figure out when I might be able to come back and bring my husband, because he would LOVE this place! It really is a fantastic value!
